description: Creamy vegan polenta topped with a spicy homemade puttanesca sauce, featuring tomatoes, capers, pepper, and olives.
name: Spicy Polenta Puttanesca
recipeIngredient: 1 and 1/2 cups plain, unsweetened non-dairy milk
1 tsp white balsamic vinegar (substitute white vinegar or cider vinegar)
1 small banana pepper (halved, seeded, and thinly sliced (see notes)
1 can diced tomatoes (14 oz or use 1 and 1/2 cups diced fresh tomatoes)
salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes (to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Bring the water and almond milk to a boil. Add the corn grits, salt, balsamic vinegar, black pepper, and dried herbs, and stir.

Reduce the heat to medium and continue to cook, stirring frequently, for 3-5 more minutes. You'll know the polenta is done when you start to see giant bubbles forming and the cornmeal is soft and fluffy.
Set aside for a few minutes before eating.
